page.title: 02MON SEJOUR FARM
page.content: {Farming}is very important in Jersey. Mon Sejour Farm, just off the{Trinity {main road,}is a {dairy}farm of {400 {vergees}owned by{Mr. Stewart Mourant.} He has 138 cows at the moment and he keeps about 40 of the newly born calves each year. When the calves are born they stay with the mother for two days and then are kept in sheds until they are a year old. The cows are milked twice a day and in the milking parlour 10 cows can be milked at one time, 5 each side. Altogether they produce about{330-340 {gallons of milk}everyday. This is stored in a large tank at 6 degrees Celsius and collected daily by the Milk Marketing Board.
